question: Some people think studying history is a waste of time while others think it is essential to learn. Discuss both views and give your opinions.
text: History is indeed a part of society and it has a huge contribution to the building of humanity. Although some might argue that the study of history is not worth anything, while some others believe it is worthwhile to study history and I suppose history does teach us precious lessons.

According to a number of people, learning history is an essential part of humankind and it helps humankind to understand insight the roof of ancestors and what people learn from the part. First of all, history helps the young generation have thorough insights into their own culture and how their country has evolved. Likewise, young people need to understand how hard their ancestors defended the nation and against invaders throughout many dynasties to get free country so that the young people should be respectful and grateful to the previous generation. Additionally, the historical documents help people have pieces of knowledge about the number of reasons why having the war between countries and the people would be avoided those reasons in the future and do not meet the same situation as the past.

On the other hand, learning history is a waste of time and vitality, it doesn't give any significant benefits to people. In fact, mankind strong believes that learning technology and society can bring tremendous benefits to the human and the experience could be utilized and contribution to the developing country. Furthermore, each historical event is interpreted differently based on many facts and perspectives so there is no guarantee of the accuracy of information obtained. In fact, there is can be the main reason for the impact of culture and religion.
To sum up, acquiring knowledge about historical events is a great experience and to build a prosperous nation, humankind must learn from history. Having the past is causing to present.
